questionTitle: The 20% <u><font color='red'>discount</font></u> is only <u><font color='red'>applicable</font></u> <u><font color='red'>for</font></u> items <u><font color='red'>costing</font></u> over $300.
It <u><font color='red'>was</font></u> <u><font color='red'>amazed</font></u> that Smith <u><font color='red'>showed</font></u> so <u><font color='red'>few</font></u> grief at his mother's death.

It's <u><font color='red'>impossible</font></u> <u><font color='red'>believing</font></u> that anyone would purposely harm a child, <u><font color='red'>least of all</font></u> <u><font color='red'>its</font></u> own mother.
The estate agent spent a ________ deal of time trying to persuade me to buy the house.
In the pub she found herself sitting ________ a well-known TV personality.
He has always wanted to see his name in ________.
If you ________ to London tomorrow, telephone me first.
There is no ________ in going to school if you're not willing to learn.
The expert ________ the painting carefully and then said it was not original.
Could you hang ________ a minute? I'll be right back!
I'm sorry I haven't got any money - I've ________ my wallet at home.
Books may be ________ from the library for up to three weeks.
She ________ her parents to let her go to England .
That's a nice coat, and the colour ________ you well.
________ his flu, he got up and went to work.
You're very quiet today. What have you got on your ________?
In some countries, there is a terrible ________ of food .
There is a beautiful ________ of the old city from the terrace of their mountain house.

After several hours on the road they became ________ to the fact that they would never reach the hotel by nightfall.
